setting.label: Local IP address
setting.help_text: Enter the IP address of this machine. Use an externally accessible address (ie, not 127.0.0.1) if you are going to be running a frontend on a different machine than this one.
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend IP address

setting.label: Port
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend server port
setting.help_text: Unless you've got good reason to, don't change this.

setting.label: Status Port
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend status port
setting.help_text: Port which the server will listen to for HTTP requests.

setting.label: Security PIN (Required)
setting.placeholder_text: Enter security PIN code
setting.help_text: PIN code required for a frontend to connect to the backend. Blank prevents all connections, 0000 allows any client to connect.

setting.label: Master Backend IP address
setting.placeholder_text: Enter master server IP address
setting.help_text: The IP address of the master backend server. All frontend and non-master backend machines will connect to this server. If you only have one backend, this should be the same IP address as above.

setting.label: Port
setting.help_text: Unless you've got good reason to, don't change this.

setting.label: TV format
setting.help_text: The TV standard to use for viewing TV.

setting.label: VBI format
setting.help_text: VBI stands for Vertical Blanking Interrupt. VBI is used to carry Teletext and Closed Captioning data.

setting.label: Channel frequency table
setting.help_text: Select the appropriate frequency table for your system. If you have an antenna, use a '-bcast' frequency.

setting.label: Your Local Timezone (for XMLTV)
setting.help_text: Used if the XMLTV data comes from a different timezone than your own. This adjust the times in the XMLTV EPG data to compensate. 'Auto' converts the XMLTV time to local time using your computer's timezone. 'None' ignores the XMLTV timezone, interpreting times as local.

setting.label: Master Backend Override
setting.help_text: If enabled, the master backend will stream and delete files if it finds them in the video directory. Useful if you are using a central storage location, like a NFS share, and your slave backend isn't running.

setting.label: Follow symbolic links when deleting files
setting.help_text: This will cause Myth to follow symlinks when recordings and related files are deleted, instead of deleting the symlink and leaving the actual file.

setting.label: Delete files slowly
setting.help_text: Some filesystems use a lot of resources when deleting large recording files. This option makes Myth delete the file slowly on this backend to lessen the impact.

setting.label: Storage Group Disk Scheduler
setting.help_text: This setting controls how the Storage Group scheduling code will balance new recordings across directories. 'Balanced Free Space' is the recommended method for most users.

setting.label: Miscellaneous Status Application
setting.placeholder_text: Enter miscellaneous status command
setting.help_text: External application or script that outputs extra information for inclusion in the backend status page. See contrib/info/misc_status_info/README

setting.label: Disable Automatic Database Backup
setting.help_text: This will prevent Myth from backing up the database before upgrades. If disabled, you should have your own backup strategy in place.

setting.label: Disable Firewire Reset
setting.help_text: By default MythTV will reset the firewire bus when a firewire recorder stops responding to commands. But if this causes problems you can disable this here for Linux firewire recorders.

setting.label: Cross Source EIT
setting.help_text: If enabled, listings data collected on one Video Source will be applied to the first matching DVB channel on any Video Source. This is sometimes useful for DVB-S, but may insert bogus data into any ATSC listings stored in the same database.

setting.label: Backend Idle Before EIT Crawl (seconds)
setting.help_text: The minimum number of seconds after a recorder becomes idle to wait before MythTV begins collecting EIT listings data.

setting.label: Startup command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter startup command
setting.help_text: This command is executed right after starting the BE. As a parameter \'$status\' is replaced by either \'auto\' if the machine was started automatically or \'user\' if a user switched it on.

setting.label: Block shutdown before client connected
setting.help_text: If set, the automatic shutdown routine will be disabled until a client connects.

setting.label: Idle shutdown timeout (secs)
setting.help_text: The amount of time the master backend idles before it shuts down all backends.

setting.label: Max. wait for recording (min)
setting.help_text: The amount of time the master backend waits for a recording. If it's idle but a recording starts within this time period, the backends won't shut down.

setting.label: Startup before rec. (secs)
setting.help_text: The amount of time the master backend will be woken up before a recording starts.

setting.label: Wakeup time format
setting.placeholder_text: Enter wakeup time format
setting.help_text: The format of the time string passed to the 'setWakeuptime Command' as $time. See QT::QDateTime.toString() for details. Set to 'time_t' for seconds since epoch.

setting.label: Command to set Wakeup Time
setting.placeholder_text: Enter wakeup time command
setting.help_text: The command used to set the wakeup time (passed as $time) for the Master Backend

setting.label: Server halt command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend halt command
setting.help_text: The command used to halt the backends.

setting.label: Pre Shutdown check-command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter pre-shutdown command
setting.help_text: A command executed before the backend would shutdown. The return value determines if the backend can shutdown. 0 - yes, 1 - restart idling, 2 - reset the backend to wait for a frontend.

setting.label: Delay between wake attempts (secs)
setting.help_text: Length of time the frontend waits between tries to wake up the master backend. This should be the time your master backend needs to startup.

setting.label: Wake Attempts
setting.help_text: Number of times the frontend will try to wake up the master backend.

setting.label: Wake Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter Wake-On-LAN command
setting.help_text: The command used to wake up your master backend server. For example 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend restart'.

setting.label: Sleep Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter LAN sleep command
setting.help_text: The command used to put this slave to sleep. If set, the master backend will use this command to put this slave to sleep when it is not needed for recording.

setting.label: Wake Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter LAN wake command
setting.help_text: The command used to wake up this slave from sleep. This setting is not used on the master backend.

setting.label: Backend Stop Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend stop command
setting.help_text: The command used to stop the backend when running on the master backend server. For example 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend stop'.

setting.label: Backend Start Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter backend start command
setting.help_text: The command used to start the backend when running on the master backend server. For example, 'sudo /etc/init.d/mythtv-backend start'.

setting.label: Maximum simultaneous jobs on this backend
setting.help_text: The Job Queue will be limited to running this many simultaneous jobs on this backend.

setting.label: Job Queue Check frequency (in seconds)
setting.help_text: When looking for new jobs to process, the Job Queue will wait this long between checks.

setting.label: Job Queue Start Time
setting.help_text: This setting controls the start of the Job Queue time window which determines when new jobs will be started.

setting.label: Job Queue End Time
setting.help_text: This setting controls the end of the Job Queue time window which determines when new jobs will be started.

setting.label: CPU Usage
setting.help_text: This setting controls approximately how much CPU jobs in the queue may consume. On 'High', all available CPU time may be used which could cause problems on slower systems.

setting.label: Allow Commercial Detection jobs
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow Transcoding jobs
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow User Job #1 on this backend
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow User Job #2 on this backend
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow User Job #3 on this backend
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Allow User Job #4 on this backend
setting.help_text: Allow jobs of this type to run on this backend.

setting.label: Run Jobs only on original recording backend
setting.help_text: If set, jobs in the queue will be required to run on the backend that made the original recording.

setting.label: Start Auto-Commercial Detection jobs when the recording starts
setting.help_text: If set and Auto Commercial Flagging is ON for a recording, the flagging job will be started as soon as the recording starts. NOT recommended on underpowered systems.

setting.label: Commercial Detection Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter commercial detection command
setting.help_text: The program used to detect commercials in a recording. The default is 'mythcommflag' if this setting is empty.

setting.label: Transcoder command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter transcode command
setting.help_text: The program used to transcode recordings. The default is 'mythtranscode' if this setting is empty.

setting.label: Run Transcode Jobs before Auto-Commercial Flagging
setting.help_text: If set, if both auto-transcode and auto commercial flagging are turned ON for a recording, transcoding will run first, otherwise, commercial flagging runs first.

setting.label: Save original files after transcoding (globally)
setting.help_text: When set and the transcoder is active, the original files will be renamed to .old once the transcoding is complete.

setting.label: User Job #1 Description
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job description
setting.help_text: The Description for this User Job.

setting.label: User Job #1 Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job command
setting.help_text: The command to run whenever this User Job number is scheduled.

setting.label: User Job #2 Description
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job description
setting.help_text: The Description for this User Job.

setting.label: User Job #2 Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job command
setting.help_text: The command to run whenever this User Job number is scheduled.

setting.label: User Job #3 Description
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job description
setting.help_text: The Description for this User Job.

setting.label: User Job #3 Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job command
setting.help_text: The command to run whenever this User Job number is scheduled.

setting.label: User Job #4 Description
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job description
setting.help_text: The Description for this User Job.

setting.label: User Job #4 Command
setting.placeholder_text: Enter user job command
setting.help_text: The command to run whenever this User Job number is scheduled.

setting.label: Video content to show a WMP Client
setting.help_text: This forces us to show WMP clients either the Recordings tree or the Video tree when they request a list of videos

setting.label: UPnP Media Update Time
setting.help_text: The number of minutes between mythbackend checking for new videos to serve via upnp. 0 = Off.

setting.label: Log MythTV events to database
setting.help_text: If enabled, MythTV modules will send event details to the database, where they can be viewed with MythLog or periodically emailed to the administrator.

setting.label: Log Print Threshold
setting.help_text: This controls what messages will be printed out as well as being logged to the database.

setting.label: Automatic Log Cleaning Enabled
setting.help_text: This enables the periodic cleanup of the events stored in the Myth database (see 'Log MythTV events to database').

setting.label: Log Cleanup Frequency (Days)
setting.help_text: The number of days between log cleanup runs.

setting.label: Number of days to keep acknowledged log entries
setting.help_text: The number of days before a log entry that has been acknowledged will be deleted by the log cleanup process.

setting.label: Number of days to keep unacknowledged log entries
setting.help_text: The number of days before a log entry that has NOT been acknowledged will be deleted by the log cleanup process.

setting.label: Maximum Number of Entries per Module
setting.help_text: If there are more than this number of entries for a module, the oldest log entries will be deleted to reduce the count to this number. Set to 0 to disable.

setting.label: Automatically update program listings
setting.help_text: This enables the automatic execution of mythfilldatabase.

setting.label: Guide Data Program
setting.placeholder_text: Enter guide data command
setting.help_text: Use 'mythfilldatabase' or the name of a custom script that will populate the program guide info for all your video sources.

setting.label: Guide Data Arguments
setting.placeholder_text: Enter guide data program arguments
setting.help_text: Any arguments you want passed to the guide data program.

setting.label: Guide Data Program Log Path
setting.placeholder_text: Enter guide data program log path
setting.help_text: File or directory to use for logging output from the mythfilldatabase program. Leave blank to disable logging.

setting.label: mythfilldatabase Run Frequency (Days)
setting.help_text: The number of days between mythfilldatabase runs.

setting.label: mythfilldatabase Execution Start
setting.help_text: This setting and the following one define a time period when the mythfilldatabase process is allowed to run.

setting.label: mythfilldatabase Execution End
setting.help_text: This setting and the preceding one define a time period when the mythfilldatabase process is allowed to run.

setting.label: Run mythfilldatabase at time suggested by the grabber.
setting.help_text: This setting allows a DataDirect guide data provider to specify the next download time in order to distribute load on their servers. If this setting is enabled, mythfilldatabase Execution Start/End times are ignored.
